summary: The "Providing Real-world Education and Clinical Experience by Precepting Tomorrow’s Nurses Act" (PRECEPT Nurses Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to address nursing shortages. It establishes a $2,000 annual tax credit for experienced registered nurses and other healthcare providers who serve as preceptors. To qualify, individuals must complete at least 200 hours of mentoring and training for nursing students or newly hired nurses within a designated Health Professional Shortage Area. The bill aims to incentivize clinical training in underserved communities. The credit is temporary, applying to tax years 2026 through 2032, and includes reporting requirements to evaluate its effectiveness.
